name: Snoopy (itch)
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.1 (beta) Details Title Snoopy Model No. SM-91 Manufacturer Nintendo Series Game & Watch (Panorama Screen) Release Date November 4, 1983 Chipset Sharp SM511 ( 32.768 kHz ) Description

In this first game to be released in Nintendo's Panorama Screen series Snoopy must strike down musical notes flying through the air.

Gameplay

Schroeder is playing his piano. The notes fly through the air to where Woodstock is sleeping. Operate Snoopy LEFT or RIGHT to move between four platforms to strike down the notes with his hammer. If a note reaches Woodstock, a miss occurs. If Snoopy moves too far left past the first platform or too far right past the last platform, he'll fall off and a miss will occur. Three misses and the game ends.

Tips
  • Game A is easier with only 3 lines of notes while GAME B is more difficult with 4 lines of notes.
  • Snoopy can only hit down a note when standing on a platform of the same color.
Trivia
  • Snoopy is the first game released in the innovative Panorama Screen format. With it's tilt-able screen, this series managed to offer the same experience as the earlier Table Top Series, but on a much more portable format and for a more affordable price.
  • Snoopy is one of three games from the earlier Table Top version re-released in the Panorama Screen format. It's gameplay is almost identical, except each of the notes played by Schroeder sounds different and each line of notes is in a different color.
  • Lucy wakes every 100 points to kick Schroeder's piano to provide a brief intermission.
